sub_title: Artist, Curator, Designer, Producer IFAA Art Platform and Director Thamgidi Foundation
summary: This is a short biography of S'thabile Mlotshwa a creator, art collector and passionate campaigner for women’s rights who sees art as a catalyst for change, innovation and human advancement.  S'thabile is Founder - Executive director of Thamgidi Foundation, Producer of Art, Books en Wine, Artistic Director Festival De Oase, Producer and artistic director of IFAA 2008 and IFAA Art Platform, visual artist, cultural producer and independent curator. She is former chair of "VAAB" the visual arts association in Bulawayo Zimbabwe, former Secretary General ResArtis, Board of directors Stichting WHAA, 2009 advisory Board member of the Gelders Balkon (Museum of Modern Art in Arnhem) and 2008 President of the Jury at the Dakart Biennale. Four of her biggest successes are: 1)Thamgidi Fund, that has to-date given more than 35 grants. 2) Building a major collection of contemporary art with the focus on Africa and the international Diaspora. 3) Producing IFAA 2008 & IFAA Art Platform, (an International cross - disciplinary Festival and artist in Residency Platform), taking place in different cities worldwide. 4) Producing Art, Books en Wine, (a network  and debate platform  bringing together creators and the corporate sector) through art, food, literature and wine. She was invited to speak at Tedx Women Amsterdam and publicised in The Next Women (an Online Magazine For Female Business Heroes) as an inspirational woman. She is publicised in the Rebelle Art & Feminism 1969 -2009 catalogue of the Museum of Modern Art in Arnhem. S’thabile was selected for the Asia-Europe Network Training Program of Independent Autonomous Art Centers in Paris organised by Asia Europe Foundation, Trans Europe Halles & Artfactories where she represented the Netherlands for the building of the Asia - Europe Network for Independent Cultural Centers.  She has illustrated books and participated in the restoration of the Cyrene Mission (restoration of a church which is on UNESCO world heritage list).

treasury_media.title: 1/8 Yacouba Konaté
treasury_media.description: "CENSURE/AUTOCENSURE DANS LES ARTS PLASTIQUES" Une séance des "Actualités critiques" de l'AICA France enregistrée au Palais de Tokyo, le 5 mars 2010 A l'heure de la recrudescence de la censure et de sa re-formulation en des formes toujours plus pernicieuses, générant des autocensures évidentes ou larvées de la part des différents acteurs de la scène artistique, les questions de la liberté de création, d'expression et de monstration restent posées.

projects.title: IFAA Art Platform
projects.description: IFAA is an international – cross -disciplinary festival and artist in residency platform that takes place in different cities across the globe. Our IFAA residency and festival are set up as an ephemeral space of encounter, facilitating creativity and knowledge production by bringing together artists from all over the world interested in collaborations that: nurture creativity and strengthen cross-cultural knowledge exchange.

owner at ARTLAB, visual artist Olivië, Independent Producer Exhibitions

projects.title: IFAA Art Platform - Communication, échange, dialogue et art.
projects.description:
L’IFAA (International Festival of Art of Arhnem) a été créé en 2008 aux Pays-Bas par la fondation Thamgidi et a été transposé dans plusieurs villes à travers le monde
En 2012, il a été accueilli à Louvain-la-Neuve comme projet pilote par l’asbl Au fil de la Terre, grâce à la participation de l'AGL, de l’UCL culture, et d’autres acteurs culturels présents sur le site de Louvain-la-Neuve. 
Ce festival international multidisciplinaire d’art contemporain comprenait une résidence d’artistes, une sensibilisation à l’art contemporain, des animations pour tous les âges, des débats et échanges sur le thème choisi pour cette première édition belge: «Communication, échange, 
dialogue et art».
IFAA amène les artistes de diverses nationalités et disciplines à collaborer , à nourrir leur créativité et à renforcer les échanges au-delà des cultures. IFAA fonctionne comme un créateur de contenu et de projets, et tisse un réseau entre les universités, les acteurs culturels, et les habitants-mêmes.
IFAA place l'art au coeur de la vie, au coeur de la ville.

Artistes invités: Kiripi Katembo (RDC), Angela de Jesus (Afrique du Sud), Keiko 
Sato (Japon/Pays-Bas), Rob Sweere (Pays-Bas), Thilleli Rahmoun (Algérie/
France), Jan Ru Wan (Taiwan/USA), Toufik Medjamia (France/Algerie), Junfeng 
(Jeff) Ding (Chine), Ivan Izquierdo (Espagne), Guy Woute (Cameroun/Belgique), 
Olivië/Oliver de Boer (Pays-Bas), Pascal Courcelles (Belgique), Robert Quint (Belgique), Mansour 
Ciss (Allemagne/Sénégal), Frouwkje Smit (Pays-Bas).

authors.headline: Artist, Curator, Designer, Producer IFAA Art Platform and Director Thamgidi Foundation
Artist, Curator, Designer, Producer IFAA Art Platform and Director Thamgidi Foundation

profile_positions.description:
IfaaContempory is an extension of IFAA Art Platform that includes a contemporary gallery, an artist database and watch list.  IfaaContemporary includes an advisory and consultancy service for art collectors interested in Contemporary art from Africa and the international diaspora. 

Most of the works presented at the IfaaContemporary gallery are from the Thamgidi collection, which consists of Contemporary Art and Design.The gallery also presents works of art by IFAA’s world leading international artists who have participated in IFAA projects since 2008.

IfaaContemporary also supports emerging talent and promotes the very best in contemporary art & design from around the globe as well as being presented in IfaaCity, IfaaRegional and IfaaGlobal major projects. Through a collaboration with Art, Books en Wine, IfaaContemporary maintains a mobile and physical cultural hub. The mobile cultural hub takes places in different cities where IFAA major projects take place. The physical cultural hub takes place for the moment only in the Netherlands, though host partnerships and brings together intellectuals, creators from - designers, musicians, writers, poets, visual & performing artists, filmmakers to share and collaborate interdisciplinary. The physical and mobile hub are also ideal for food and wine lovers and include: exhibitions, hosts talks, performances, workshops, seminars and master classes: see http://www.ifaacontemporary.biz/
profile_positions.title: Founding Director

profile_positions.description:
IFAA Global is the international branch of IFAA Art Platform that strengthens and facilitates inter-disciplinary cooperation across cultures. The core business of IFAA Global is supporting the development of art platforms, biennales, Festivals, Design Platforms, Art initiatives, institutions, grassroots organisations, local and international networks that strive for or seek to develop fruitful collaborative projects, desire to transform their communities with the purpose of encouraging the building and sharing of knowledge, strengthening the arts, the development of cultural industries, connecting cultures and the Celebrating of a Culture of Cultures. At IFAA Global, we see the arts as a catalyst for change innovation and human advancement and thus welcome partnerships that enable this cause. 

Achievements to date: 
Within a year of existence, IFAA Global co-produced and financed the 1st edition of Yango Biennale. Including the realisation of Yango biennale Prizes worth 80.000 euros that were made possible though IFAA partners. 

We see this as a great start for a long journey ahead. We look forward to facilitating and supporting the realisation of many more projects to come - world-wide.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
I have been working as an independent curator since 2008 - where I produced IFAA - (international festival of art and artist in residency platform), bringing together artists from across the globe to collaborate in ways that foster fruitful, inter-disciplinary exchanges across cultures. I was invited to curate Ravy 2012 but was unable to attend due to censorship.

Since 2008, IFAA projects have been shown in England and China - including the realization of IFAA 2009 in Amsterdam, IFAA Belgium in 2012, the development IFAA Contemporary and IFAA Afghanistan for 2015. Besides this, this major successful platform now includes; IFAA Regional that has facilitated and co-produced major projects in different cities in the Netherlands and IFAA Global that co-produced Yango Biennale in 2014.
profile_positions.title: Independent Curator

profile_positions.description:
IFAA is an (international cross-disciplinary festival and artist in residency platform), bringing together artists from across the globe to collaborate in ways that foster fruitful, inter-disciplinary exchanges across cultures. 

Since 2008, IFAA projects have been shown in England and China - including the realization of IFAA 2009 in Amsterdam, IFAA Belgium in 2012, the development IFAA Contemporary and IFAA Afghanistan for 2015. Besides this, this major successful platform now includes; IFAA Regional that has facilitated and co-produced major projects in different cities in the Netherlands and IFAA Global that co-produced Yango Biennale in 2014. 

Launched in 2008 as a pilot project IFAA has developed into a platform that not only brings artists to collaborate, but also works as an information center for upcoming projects, applications deadlines, giving visibility to artists' and as a network platform for creative industries. The most active IFAA social network can be found on Facebook under the name  IFAA Platform.
To know more about IFAA please visit: www.ifaa-platform.org
profile_positions.title: Producer and artistic director IFAA

profile_positions.description: I founded the Thamgidi Studio Foundation, the Art and Young people education program, the artist in residency center and the Thamgidi Fund. I also produced IFAA (a cross disciplinary festival and artist in residency platform) now taking place in different cities world wide. I am also the producer of Art books en Wine - a face to face network whose focus is on building knowledge and connecting people through literature and public debates. Besides this, one of my functions within the Thamgidi is collecting contemporary art, building an information centre and collaborative partnerships.

profile_positions.title: Curator 1st edition Yango Biennale

profile_positions.description:
I am responsible for ensuring the successful and well attendance of the festival – including: Planning - overall development and safety of the festival. Putting an interesting and appealing festival program, building partnerships, scouting and recruiting good talent. Building the festival concept – theme. Developing and bringing creative and new ideas to the festival that in turn ensures a qualitative program. Fundraising, overseeing all financial details, developing economic and budgetary strategies, scheduling specific fundraising events, applying for grants,
Besides this, multi-tasking, troubleshooting unexpected problems, achieving conflict resolution, delegating responsibilities and inspiring performers to give their best is part and parcel of my daily work.
profile_positions.title: Artistic Director Festival De Oase

volunteer_experiences.description: An Arts and Cultural organization that focused on strengthening the position of Migrant communities though organizing projects and a major diversity festival that gave the diverse communities a voice.
